alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Clay; Lewis; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Taylor; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 5:01PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of gusty showers will impact portions of northwestern Randolph, northern Nicholas, southeastern Taylor, southeastern Lewis, Braxton, Upshur, Webster, central Clay and Barbour Counties through 545 PM EST... At 459 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers along a line extending from near Newburg to near Sutton to near Clay. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Buckhannon, Grafton, Philippi, Sutton, Clay, Audra State Park, Webster Springs, Belington, Gassaway, Addison (Webster Springs), Mill Creek, Camden-On-gauley, Dailey, Birch River, Holly River State Park, Craigsville, Camden On Gauley, Rock Cave and Harrison. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 51 and 71. Route 19 between mile markers 46 and 68. Route 33 between mile markers 3 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building until the strong winds subside.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Braxton; Clay; Lewis; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Taylor; Upshur
